segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by means of which the sender must uniquely identify the BANSTA message using its type and number and its function (e.g. response, enquiry, status etc.).
DTM, A segment specifying the date and, if required, the time the message is created.
BUS, A segment identifying certain characteristics of the Banking Status message, such as its business function.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying a previously-sent message, and/or customer to customer reference and related dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment specifying the reference of the previously-sent message.
DTM, A segment identifying the creation date of the referenced message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the financial institutions involved in the Banking Status message, routing functions and contacts.

segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution(s) associated with the transaction, in coded or uncoded form and their function.
CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the party specified in the leading FII segment to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment identifying communication type(s) and number(s) of person(s) or department(s) specified in the associated CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying the name(s) and address(es) of non- financial parties involved in the transaction, their function and their contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the names and addresses of the non- financial parties associated with the Banking Status message, in coded or uncoded form, and their function.
CTA, A segment identifying a person or department for the party specified in the NAD segment and to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment identifying communication type(s) and number(s) of person(s) or department(s) specified in the associated CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying a message or transaction and the status of the referred message/transaction, as well as any reasons clarifying the status.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the beginning of the details related to the previously-sent message by a sequential line number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments specifying reference number(s), date/or time needed in order to identify a referenced message or transaction.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment providing references of the message/transaction to be referred to.
DTM, A segment identifying the date/time of the referred message or transaction.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments identifying the status, and any reasons clarifying this status, of the referred message/transaction.

segment.documentation: SEQ, A segment identifying the beginning of the specification of the status and related details about the message/transaction by a sequential number.

GEI, A segment specifying the processing status of a referenced message/transaction in a coded form. It is used in conjunction with one or more of the following segments or groups clarifying the detailed reply or status/information.
DTM, A segment identifying dates and/or times related to information in the GEI-segment.
MOA, A segment identifying the amount(s) associated with the related information in the GEI-segment.
CUX, A segment identifying the currency associated with the related information in the GEI segment.
PCD, A segment identifying the percentage associated with the related information in the GEI segment.
FTX, A segment specifying free form data associated with the related information in the GEI segment.
DOC, A segment identifying the documents associated with the related information in the GEI segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying the financial institution(s) associated with the related information in the GEI segment.

segment.documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution(s) associated with the related information in the GEI segment.
CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the party specified in the leading FII segment to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment identifying communication type(s) and number(s) of person(s) or departments(s) specified in the associated CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying the name and address of non- financial parties associated with the related information in the GEI segment.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and address of non-financial parties associated with the related information in the GEI segment.
CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the party specified in the leading NAD segment to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment identifying communication type(s) and number(s) of person(s) or departments(s) specified in the associated CTA segment.
CNT, A segment identifying the kind of control-checks and the total according to the coded form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments specifying details of any authentication (validation) procedures applied to the BANSTA message.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment specifying the details of any authentication (validation) procedures applied to the BANSTA message.
DTM, A segment identifying the validation date/time.
